yes    sudo e2fsck -c   DEVICEHERE;   does a disk check and then runs badblocks, which checks for clusters and sectors physical state inthe drive

there's no fixing for bad sectors/clusters, just 'marking' so the OS doesn't use them, but most if not all HDs these days use S.M.A.R.T which does  that automatically when one goes bad
